Articles.Content:
Hey, I'm fairly new to the forums and I've decided to start sharing some of my crafts with you guys, hope you like 'em.

Here at KerbKat Avionics INC., we strive to be the best in aircraft ingenuity, granted our company is new and some of our crafts don't look quite how those other guys do it....and maybe we failed some of those "saftey tests"...but who cares?!?! We've got SPUNK!

KerbKat Avionics INC. is not responsible for any injuries that may ensue from the use of any KerbKat Avionics merchandise including but not limited to, dismemberment, incineration, lacerations, loss of limbs, burns, cuts, bruises, loss of appetite, ouchies, booboos, diarrhea, constipation, or loss of life. It is highly recommended to see a life insurance consultant before using any KerbKat Avionics merchandise.

The first off the line from KerbKat's Design room floor comes this beautiful, magnificent,eh....what is it?

Why, it's the DeathWish-X1! Are you tired of conforming to the "norm", with all those "wings" and "aerodynamics" when it comes to your complex peices of air mechinery? Are you looking for something that has class, form, and power? Something that says; lookout world, I got a need for speed and I have a large life insurance policy on myself? Well look no further, the DeathWish-X1 is the aircraft you desire! We here at KerbKat labs thought "Hey, you know what's fun? CANARDS, that's what!!!", and I mean, we REALLY like canards, you won't find a tiny two, or three, or even four or five...we slapped a whopping FOURTEEN on our craft! Take THAT Kerbosphere INC.! I know what you're asking now, "well what good is a aircraft with no wings and 14 canards without any thrust?" Well shut your pretty little mouth, we packed TWO turbojet engines on each side of the DeathWish to give it a whopping 180m/s top speed! So now you're wondering "How do I get my hands on one of these hot potatoes?!?!", well hold your horses Daisy Duke and just download yourself KerbKat's handy dandy craft blueprint and take her out for a spin!

http://www./?5o0abtr06a2ihf0

Notes about the craft: When taking off, use 1/2 max thrust. Ship flies best at 2/3 max thrust. Fly with "fine-control" turned on.

We here at KerbKat INC believe that if it's not broke, make it TWICE as awesome as it was before, so we took the DeathWish-X1 that we all know and love, and made it 2x more death...wishy. That's right folks we added double the canard fun, now for a total TWENTYEIGHT canards. Now we all love canards, but we here at KerbKat believe that our customers deserve the BEST...so we went ahead and threw two more turbo-jet engines into the mix. This baby REALLY has a kick! Opened up she maxes out at a robust 210 m/s, AND has the ability to turn on a dime! (KerbKat Avionics INC. is not responsible for any pilot black-outs due to extreme g's) So what are you waiting for?!?! Come on down to KerbKat and get your own DeathWish-X2, TODAY!

http://www./?8u4hd5jud4hcj6h

Notes about aircraft: 1/4 of full throttle advised for takeoff. Flying with fine-control turned on is highly advised

Edited October 12, 2012 by sal_vager
